intro: Mespilodaphne morae, commonly known as the Morae's mespilodaphne, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
